definitions.definition: The amount of money levied for a service.
definitions.example: There will be a charge of five dollars.

definitions.definition: A ground attack against a prepared enemy.
definitions.example: Pickett did not die leading his famous charge.

definitions.definition: A forceful forward movement.
An accusation.
definitions.example: That's a slanderous charge of abuse of trust.

definitions.definition: An electric charge.
The scope of someone's responsibility.
definitions.example: The child was in the nanny's charge.

definitions.definition: Someone or something entrusted to one's care, such as a child to a babysitter or a student to a teacher.
definitions.example: The child was a charge of the nanny.

definitions.definition: A load or burden; cargo.
definitions.example: The ship had a charge of colonists and their belongings.

definitions.definition: An instruction.
definitions.example: I gave him the charge to get the deal closed by the end of the month.

definitions.definition: An offensive foul in which the player with the ball moves into a stationary defender.
A measured amount of powder and/or shot in a firearm cartridge.
An image displayed on an escutcheon.
A position (of a weapon) fitted for attack.
definitions.example: to bring a weapon to the charge

definitions.definition: A sort of plaster or ointment.
Weight; import; value.
A measure of thirty-six pigs of lead, each pig weighing about seventy pounds; a charre.
An address given at a church service concluding a visitation.
To assign a duty or responsibility to
To assign (a debit) to an account
To pay on account, as by using a credit card
definitions.example: Can I charge my purchase to my credit card?

definitions.definition: To require payment (of) (a price or fee, for goods, services, etc.)
definitions.example: I won't charge you for the wheat

definitions.definition: (possibly archaic) to sell at a given price.
definitions.example: to charge coal at $5 per unit

definitions.definition: To formally accuse (a person) of a crime.
definitions.example: I'm charging you with assault and battery.

definitions.definition: To impute or ascribe
To call to account; to challenge
To place a burden or load on or in
To load equipment with material required for its use, as a firearm with powder, a fire hose with water, a chemical reactor with raw materials
definitions.example: Charge your weapons; we're moving up.

definitions.definition: To move forward quickly and forcefully, particularly in combat and/or on horseback
(of a hunting dog) to lie on the belly and be still (A command given by a hunter to a dog)
